{{Spanish name|Camarasa|Ferrando}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Víctor Camarasa | image = | fullname = Víctor Camarasa Ferrando | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1994|5|28|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Meliana]], Spain | height = {{convert|1.83|m|ftin|0|abbr=on}} | position = [[Midfielder#Central midfielder|Midfielder]] | currentclub = [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]]
(on loan from [[Real Betis|Betis]]) | clubnumber = 21 | youthyears1 = 2001–2011 | youthclubs1 = [[Valencia CF|Valencia]] | youthyears2 = 2011–2012 | youthclubs2 = [[CD Alcoyano|Alcoyano]] | youthyears3 = 2012–2013 | youthclubs3 = [[Levante UD|Levante]] | years1 = 2013–2014 | clubs1 = [[Atlético Levante UD|Levante B]] | caps1 = 27 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2014–2017 | clubs2 = [[Levante UD|Levante]] | caps2 = 61 | goals2 = 4 | years3 = 2016–2017 | clubs3 = → [[Deportivo Alavés|Alavés]] (loan) | caps3 = 31 | goals3 = 3 | years4 = 2017– | clubs4 = [[Real Betis|Betis]] | caps4 = 24 | goals4 = 1 | years5 = 2018– |clubs5 = → [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] (loan) |caps5 = 24 | goals5 = 3 | nationalyears1 = 2014–2017 | nationalteam1 = [[Spain national under-21 football team|Spain U21]] | nationalcaps1 = 4 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | club-update = 17:10, 2 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = }} '''Víctor Camarasa Ferrando''' (born 28 May 1994) is a Spanish professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for Welsh club [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] on loan from [[Real Betis]] as a [[Midfielder#Central midfielder|central midfielder]]. ==Club career== ===Levante=== Born in [[Meliana]], [[Valencian Community]], Camarasa joined local [[Valencia CF]]'s youth categories in 2001, aged seven. Ten years later he was released, and eventually finished his formation with neighbouring [[Levante UD]], making his senior debuts with the [[Atlético Levante UD|reserve side]] in the [[2012–13 Segunda División B|2012–13 season]], in [[Segunda División B]].[http://www.mundodeportivo.com/20130912/fc-barcelona/barca-levante-filial-fichajes-victor-camarasa_54381344850.html El Barça sigue a Víctor Camarasa (Barça follow Víctor Camarasa)]; [[Mundo Deportivo]], 12 September 2013 (in Spanish) On 7 December 2013, Camarasa played his first official game with the main squad, starting in a 0–1 away loss against [[Recreativo de Huelva]] for [[2013–14 Copa del Rey|the campaign]]'s [[Copa del Rey]].[http://www.marca.com/eventos/marcador/futbol/2013_14/copa/dieciseisavos/ida/rec_lev/ Ruymán decide 'a puerta cerrada' (Ruymán decides 'behind closed doors')]; [[Marca (newspaper)|Marca]], 7 December 2013 (in Spanish) Two days later he signed a new six-year deal with the club,[http://www.plazadeportiva.com/ver/14193/el-levante-renueva-a-sus-perlas--jason-y-victor-camarasa.html El Levante renueva a sus perlas, Jason y Victor Camarasa (Levante renew their gems, Jason and Victor Camarasa)]; Plaza Deportiva, 9 December 2013 (in Spanish) and he scored his first goal on the 17th, helping turn the Cup deficit in his team's favour by netting the last in the 4–0 home win.[http://www.marca.com/eventos/marcador/futbol/2013_14/copa/dieciseisavos/vuelta/lev_rec/ Vendaval granota hacia octavos (''Granota'' blizzard en route to last-16)]; Marca, 17 December 2013 (in Spanish) Camarasa made his [[La Liga]] debut on 4 January 2014, coming on as a [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] for [[Simão Mate Junior|Simão Mate]] in a 0–2 away loss against [[Valencia CF]].[http://www.marca.com/2014/01/04/futbol/1adivision/1388868940.html ¡Che, qué bueno que viniste! (''Che'', so good of you to come!)]; Marca, 4 January 2014 (in Spanish) In July he was promoted to the first team,[http://levanteud.lasprovincias.es/noticias/201407/31/victor-camarasa-mendilibar-quiere-20140731175508.html Víctor Camarasa: «Mendilibar quiere algo distinto a lo que quería Caparrós» (Víctor Camarasa: "Mendilibar wants something different from what Caparrós wanted")]; [[Las Provincias]], 31 July 2014 (in Spanish) and was made a starter by new manager [[José Luis Mendilibar]]. On 4 October 2014, Camarasa scored his first goal in the top flight, netting his side's second in a 3–3 draw at [[SD Eibar]].[http://www.espnfc.com/spanish-primera-divisi%C3%B3n/match/402566/eibar-levante/report Piovaccari levels thriller late on]; [[ESPN FC]], 4 October 2014 On 11 August 2016, after [[2015–16 La Liga|suffering relegation]], he was loaned to [[Deportivo Alavés]] also in the top tier, for one year.[http://www.deportivoalaves.com/noticia/camarasa-potencia-calidad-y-llegada-para-el-centro-del-campo Camarasa, potencia, calidad y llegada para el centro del campo (Camarasa, power, skill and definition for the midfield)]; Deportivo Alavés, 11 August 2016 (in Spanish) ===Betis=== On 29 June 2017, Camarasa signed a five-year contract with fellow league club [[Real Betis]].[http://realbetisbalompie.es/en/noticias/last-news/9427/el-real-betis-incorpora-victor-camarasa Real Betis signs Víctor Camarasa]; Real Betis, 29 June 2017 He scored his first competitive goal for them on 18 December, helping close a 2–0 away defeat of neighbouring [[Málaga CF]].{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/eventos/marcador/futbol/2017_18/la-liga/jornada_16/mga_bet/|title=Y al séptimo día, resucitó|trans-title=And on the seventh day, they came back to life|newspaper=Marca|last=Morán|first=Miguel Ángel|language=es|date=18 December 2017|accessdate=14 August 2018}} On 9 August 2018, Camarasa joined [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] on loan for the [[2018–19 Premier League|2018–19 season]].{{cite web|url=https://www.cardiffcityfc.co.uk/news/2018/august/deadline-day--victor-camarasa-joins-on-loan/|title=Victor Camarasa signs on loan|publisher=Cardiff City F.C|date=9 August 2018|accessdate=9 August 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/45126885|title=Victor Camarasa: Cardiff City confirm midfielder loan deal|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=9 August 2018|accessdate=9 August 2018}} He made his [[Premier League]] debut nine days later, playing 76 minutes in a 0–0 home draw against [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/45153217|title=Cardiff City 0–0 Newcastle United|publisher=BBC Sport|last=Pritchard|first=Dafydd|date=18 August 2018|accessdate=18 August 2018}} His first goal came on 2 September, but in a 2–3 loss to [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] also at the [[Cardiff City Stadium]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/45312124|title=Cardiff City 2–3 Arsenal|publisher=BBC Sport|last=Pearlman|first=Michael|date=2 September 2018|accessdate=22 December 2018}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|2 March
